item.description:
The IMAX at the Museum of Science is showing an interesting movie about the timeless ceremonies in India. I think it would be an interesting viewing for our group. The movie is only 50 min long, we'll got a neighboring bar/cafe to grab a bite or a drink and discuss the movie afterwards (perhaps an Indian Buffet at
Desi Dhaba at 401 Massachusetts Avenue (Central square) will be appropriate http://www.desidhaba....)

Please buy your own tickets. The Adult price is $9.00.
Let's meet at the ticket office for the Imax at 12:40 so that we can get acquainted and then proceed to the theater.


Here is from the Museum's description.
The IMAXÂ® Dome screen showcases the stunning architecture, rich culture, and timeless ceremonies of one of the world's most intriguing civilizations. From the banks of the Ganges to the snowy Himalayas, through the rainforests of Assam and the tropical jungles of the Sunderbans, discover a diversity of peoples and landscapes as you follow in the steps of an 11-year-old pilgrim who left home 200 years ago in search of enlightenment

http://www.mos.org/ex...
item.how_to_find_us: We will be in from of the ticket box

group.name: Practical Philosophy -- Application of Timeless Wisdom

item.name: Movie at Museum of Science: Mystic India
